review_content: Barva svetle zlatava, pena nizka a hned pryc. Vune sladova. Chut malo horka, trochu slamova, hodne lehke telo az do vodova. Ke konci takovej sladkej dezertik - asi ta kukurice. Hodne bublinek. Jizanska zalezitost, zadna hitpatada.

500ml can. Aldi. Pours light straw with not much of a head. Aroma is sweet malt, white bread, lemon, yeasty and hint of corn. Medium strength lager at 4.7%. Refreshing, crisp and clean. Taste is light bread and sweet malt, touch of corn, yeasty, metallic finish, lemon hop. Low bitterness. Actually not bad chilled down. Definitely prefer this to the stronger Peroni.
Nice cans from Aldi , north berwick. Sunk  a few over a week . Lovely chilled and easy chugged . Enjoyed . Far better than retrospective score , as forgot to rate at time.
Aroma 4. Appearance 3. Taste 3. Palate 2. Overall 9. Limited aroma of malt. Grain taste when very cold, then more and more on cardboard taste.
W aromacie słód i kukurydza. Barwa złota, klarowne, piana ładna. W smaku słodowe, nieco alkoholowe, wodniste. Goryczka niska, wysycenie wysokie. Kiepskie.
Nicely made light lager. A bit of a fruity backbone, balanced by a slightly smokey bitterness. Black Dog Ams
ja goed italiaans bier echt kk lekker bij italiaans eten pastatje ofzo echt genieten
Barwa złota, klarowne, piana biała, niezbyt obfita, niezbyt trwała. W aromacie słodowe. W smaku słodowe, wodniste, niska goryczka. Wysycenie niskie do średniego. Taki tam lekki lagerek, nuda.
Poor head, almost no aroma, maybe some grain. Pale golden body. Watery and that's all.
Prima pils, ligt zoet en iets bitter, redelijke body en drinkt makkelijk weg.
Birra bionda senza infamia e senza lode, beverina e semplice, adatta da pasto

Aroma includes bready malt and a slight spicy hop note. Subtle though.
Flavours include a bit of faint sweet malt with a slight bready note and a touch of cardboard.
Bottle 4/25/95 Old Notes (Old Chicago COS) Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of corn and grains. Taste of the same. This light bodied pale lager is just another beer.
Sweet, herbal floral aroma. High carbonation, golden pour off white head not very persistent. Sweet at the beginning, slightly malty, then hoppy, herbal and crisp clean finish.

È stata la mia prima birra. Ed è stata la prima birra per tantissima gente. Crescendo ho smesso di amarla, e la bevo solo di rado quando vado da qualcuno e ha solo lei in frigo. Per tutto il resto è una semplicissima lager industriale, nulla di che. Comunque i ricordi con lei sono tanti e indimenticabile ❤️

Flavours include a bit of faint sweet malt with a slight bready note and a touch of cardboard.
Bottle 4/25/95 Old Notes (Old Chicago COS) Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of corn and grains. Taste of the same. This light bodied pale lager is just another beer.
Sweet, herbal floral aroma. High carbonation, golden pour off white head not very persistent. Sweet at the beginning, slightly malty, then hoppy, herbal and crisp clean finish.

Had a 66cl bottle from local store in Italy, to try it again after a long time. It's extremely famous and easily available everywhere in Italy for quite cheap price. Clear golden color and white foam head. A lager made with corn and you can tell that straight away from taste, which to me isn't that great or exciting at all. High enough carbonation, light body and mild taste, a bit like a corn instead of rice budweiser, except maybe something off in the aftertaste. Malty and Corn taste. Sweet and can't grasp much hops. There is worse for sure but i really can't recommend it, you may occasionally give it a try cold with some dish to see if you like it better

Una normale lager dal profumo carico di malto con qualche leggero sentore floreale, dal colore dorato e la schiuma abbondante e pannosa. Il gusto è molto leggero e si avvertono molto i cereali e un pò i luppoli. Come direbbe Fantozzi, è ideale da bere davanti ad un partita di calcio gustandosi un frittatone di cipolle...e rutto libero!
Esta es nuestra San Miguel. Bueno, no llega a la Estrella Galicia, para que me entiendas, pero no está nada mal. Sí Has estado en Italia, siempre que te bebas un trago te transportará hasta allí.
0.5 can from local store. Pours golden color, with weak short lasting foam. So watery, lemonade taste. Weak. Vrlo lose pivo, slabo i nikakvo.

Strong smell of bread. Low carbonated. Would put this lager in taste wise in between a lager and pale ale due to its low carbonate content. After taste similar to Jack Daniels whisky. Very underwhelmed.
Jeśli piłeś Tyskie to nie musisz tego próbować. Eurolager bez większych wad i zalet. Ocena wysoka, bo zapobiegł odwodnieniu się w ponad 35°C Rzymie.
Zlatnozute boje, tanka bijela pjena, skoro nepostojana. Slabe arome kvasca, trave i kukuruza. Slabe gorčne, kratkog, blago gorkog finiša. Vodene teksture, jake karbonizacije.

Pours a clear yellow color with a weak white head, corn / malt smell, crisp sweet taste, medium texture. Marginally better than balnkan lagers I'm used to.

300ml bottle

Non capisco niente uè, Capisco solo la peroni. 18 46
18 46 18 46
18 46
18 46
Clear gold on pour, bright and bubbly. Some floral aromas, with a light malty taste. It’s ok.

Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into mug. 
Appearance: Clear golden colour, (loud) medium head which soon fades.
Aroma: Malt, hay, corn. 
Palate: Light and watery body, gentle carbonation.
Taste: Malt, hay, corn, grains, gently citrus, gently hops, gently bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Drinkable while cold, very easy; usual industrial lager.

on tap. Pours orange with small head. A: sour dry white wine, fermented tangerines T: waterly, fermented sour fruits, disgusting 0.7

0.66 l bottle. Pours clear golden with soapy head. A: generic lager, T: mild carbonated, thin body, low malt, some bitterness, blend generic taste 1.8
Bottle. Poured a golden yellow color with a white head and nice lacing. Tasted straw, sweet malts, with a crisp finish. High carbonation, thin body. Overall, average at best.

Poured from a bottle into a tulip glass.  Fruity aroma. Pours a crystal clear, golden colour.  Small white head that dissipates to form patchy lacing.  Medium bodied with good carbonation.  Typical macro-brewery European beer.  Not bad for its type, but I don’t like the type much.
12 ounce bottle at Chili’s in San Juan Puerto Rico. Smell the grain. Light yellow in color. Light white head. Smooth and light. Grainy aftertaste. Easy to drink. Cheers!
Eurolager,  ze wszystkimi jego typowymi cechami. Puste, lekkie mocno wysycone, nieinwazyjne, nieciekawe. 2k18.
0,33 bottle. Sweet corny aroma. Small white foam. Medium carbonated. Light and sweet taste. Very refreshing good for hot days
2019 - 10 - 21  330ml bottle. yellow golden colour. small, white head. cardboard and hay in aroma. light bitter taste

Klarowne i złote. 
Z ładną pianą. 
Bardzo nikły słodowy aromat. 
Średnie wysycenie. Wytrawne raczej. 
Skromna ziołowa goryczka.
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.
# 351; 7/2016. Nevýrazný, sladový ležák s nedobrou vůní a nižší plností a obilnou dochutí.
Helder lichtgeel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is licht bitter en enigszins zoet met een wat rare muffe bijsmaak. Valt zwaar tegen.

First time I’ve ever seen a canned Peroni so I had to try if there is any difference between a bottle or a can. To be honest it tastes fresher, it seems more crisp and also smells better. Although it’s just a “regular” macro-brewed beer it’s quite good and well balanced, I like this wayyy more than Heineken and Amstel for example. But Hertog Jan still is my number 1 easy-to-drink pale lager/pilsner!
Blik gekocht tijdens vakantie in Italië. Goudgeel helder bier met een vreemde geur. Schuim trekt snel weg. De smaak is licht moutig. Voor mij is dit een pilsener in de lagere regionen.
Pours golden with a thick white head. Aroma of rich malt, grass. Taste has floral malt, rich. Palate is much of the same. Much better than a typical international lager.
Nice refreshing lunchtime beer. Doesn’t taste as strong as its big brother, but we shall see.
Found in apartman fridge in Roma. No aroma and watery. Worst ittalian beer.

It tastes more like some kind of a corn syrup than beer, but, all in all, I found it very refreshing on hot summer days. 
It's fine with the Serbian barbecue specialties.
Hazy yellow, no foam, no bitter, just little malty-corny taste..more watery. Can't surely be called beer..

Aroma - malts, corn
Taste - moderately sweet, light, watery. Hoppy bitterness hides deep in the aftertaste. 
Not a bad beer, just too boring. A good thing to wash food.
Excellent beer.  Nice clean refreshing taste.  When not available I drink Heineken but overall Peroni is better to me.  Can't find it everywhere.
Nicer bottled, tad light. Easy to see off a few in one sitting, not my favourite alongside food.
An italian, clear Pale Lager with white head. Aroma is mat, yeast. Taste is bitter sweet.
Bottle from a supermarket in Sicily.  Pours blond with a thin white head. Corn syrup flavour.
La birra più schifosa che abbia mai bevuto. Orribile in tutto. Se potessi darei meno di zero. Per me sembra acqua sporca.

Bottle. Yellow with a white head that doesn't last. Grainy aroma with weeds. Sweet. A cooked corn note flabs out the mostly vacant middle and the end is slightly but somehow still harshly bitter. Quite bad.

Una birra storica, una buona lager commerciale. Non sarà la migliore birra al mondo, non ha un'intensità olfattiva che va oltre la mediocrità, però ogni italiano ha un legame affettivo con questa birra, che può competere benissimo con le altre lager, italiane e non, da supermercato.
Superb easy drinking European example of a beer. A clear amber pouring beer with great flavour.

33 cl
Kupljeno u omanjem ducanu u Anconi.. 
Vrlo blago, mekano i vodenasto pivo.. 
Boja bistra zuta, pjena solidna, no brzo nestaje.. okus blago gaziran, bez gorcine.. dosta slabo, vise za natakat se po vrucini, nego uzivat u okusu..

Vorrei dire solo due perole su questa birra fantastica la meglio birra che ci esiste, non sapete mai quanto disseta vicino alla merenna con la mortadella o vicino alla pizza da Gigino, non esiste altro dio al di fuori di giovanni peroni, il 1846 è nato una leggenda questa si chiama peroni per noi Grazie

Color amarillo, cristalina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma discreto a maiz. Gusto a maíz, ligero cereal y buena dosis de óxido. Cuerpo acuoso. Si me costase 0.40€ en el super, sería como mi Steinburg de botellón con los colegas, pero a España llega a precio de Duvel... un desastre.

Aus der Flasche im Hotel
Helles klares gelb, wenig Schaum.
Aroma wie Geschmack von Malzsüsse dominiert mit etwas Heu und etwas würzig. Wässrig.
First beer I had while visiting Italy, I’d say it’s an Italian Budweiser with a lighter taste.
My first Italian beer!  Lemon, grass, straw and some very light fruits. Light carbonation.  Very light bitter finish. Goes down very easy.
11-12-18 // bottle at La Galleria Italiana Berlin paired with some great Pasta.Not much words on the beer, italians most famous lager beer. Solid boring lager.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Aromat słód, delikatne zioła. W smaku słód, zioła, miodek. Mocno nasycone. Bez szału. Wodniste. Typowy eurolager.

Cerveza de cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media. Aroma a malta y un poco herbáceo. Al tomarla, en boca se vuelve a destacar la malta. Es moderamente dulce con un pequeño final amargo. Regular y a gusto personal, superior a Moretti.

Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head and no real lacing. 

Aroma is corn, straw, plastic and vegetable. Taste is sweet with an oddly artificial finish.

Odd taste, perhaps the hop oil or just some bad process in there when mass producing?

Das Peroni ist wohl eines der bekanntesten italienischen Biere, das es auch schon eine beträchtliche Zeit gibt.
Es ist ein leichtes Lagerbier, das gut an einen Strand passt, aber nicht so primitiv wie z.B, asiatische Strandbiere.
Vielleicht kein Meisterwerk, aber ein angenehmes Lager.
Keg at gran caffe Amalfi. Pours clear golden, nose is grass, lemon, hay, taste is sweet, grassy, cereal.

Pale gold with thin white head and steady stream of bubbles rising through
Aroma is grainy with hints of hop
Flava is grain and moderate sweetness 
Feels light clean not watery with nice lively fizz
Finishes dry tangy mildly bitter
Een standaard pils-achtige smaak met een goudgele kleur. witte schuimkraag en een matige hoeveelheid koolzuur. -backlog de BierApp-
Naprosto zbytečný import do mnoha zemí, kde se toto pivo podává. Dodnes nechápu proč.

Bottle from Tempo supermarket. Clear golden colour with minimal head, aroma is weak , corn and malt , metal too. Taste is malty , corny , classic cheap lager. light body, soft carbonation, no aftertaste.

One of those oft overlooked macro's I swore I have rated years ago. Into its own glass, chilled. Orange gold and bright as bright with a short, soft pillow of white atop. Sweet, gritty and grainy, cereal-like nose with hints of chaff, hay bales and grassy hops. Dusty, powdery cereal malts on the palate with light touch of cardboard and dried, mown grass late. Very light bodied, featherweight, and highly carbonated. Gassy in the stomach. Crisp on the finish with only a faint hint of malt lasting. It has an indistinguishable sharpness or acidity to it that builds as it warms. Clean and easy to drink.My main flaw with this is typical heavy filtration and force carbonation, as well as pasteurisation leaving it without a soul and a little one-dimensional. Meh! (33cL, BBE 01/19, 1st Choice Liquor, Willetton)
Pours golden clear. Aroma of bread and grass. Taste is crisp with some pale malt sweetness.

Aroma; il pane, le purè di mele, i malti al caramello, il luppolo morbido.
Aspetto; testa superba e dorata chiara.
Il sapore; malto dolce, il pane morbido, note di mele, luppolo morbido,
e una finitura normale.
La sensazione; corpo medio, normale carbonatazione.
Complessivamente; servito fresco, buono
[apprezzato in tapas]

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from a local Italian store, best before September 2019. Clear, golden with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, slightly grassy-spicy and a little musty aroma of grains and a touch of straw. Moderately sweet, minimally bitter, faintly grassy-spicy taste of grains and some straw, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a bit grassy-spicy finish with notes of cardboard. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Far from great, drinkable nevertheless.

8/30/18
At Carabba’s with the Lawrence fam. 

Clear straw with a. Slight head. Looks like a bit any other lager. 

Smells like jelly, of all things. Also a whiff of lager-like malt. 

Taste is crazy sweet with lots of jelly, and sugar white bread dominating. Not even a hint of bitterness. 

Palate is light and crisp. Supremely drinkable. On the order of Miller lite for beers I could crush a bunch of. 

Overall, pretty darn tasty! Wasn’t expecting the jelly-like sugar flavor but I️ like it a lot.  Pretty great lager!

0,33l bottle. Clear yellow colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: A little bit boozey and skunky. Taste: Has a short malty start with sourish/skunky side tones and a strong but unpleasent bitter mouthfeel. Light body with lively carbonation. Long lasting unpleasent bitter finish. This is a bad lager.
Bière qui ne sert qu'à apporter de l'eau à l'organisme. Très classique, elle ne se distingue par rien se particulier. Bon... si l'Italie faisait de la bonne bière, ça se saurait...
Fles gekregen van PatrickdJ. Het is een goudgeel bier met een wit schuim. Het heeft een moutige geur. De smaak is standaard pilsner achtig.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi.
ottima birra nella sua categoria di prezzo gusto morbido e asciutto, nulla di superfluo.
On tap at some Italian restaurant in Elkton, VA. Sweet grainy aromas, light grass. Clear gold with a mostly fading white head. Sweet, malt-forward. Light bodied.
Can at the Alitalia Lounge at Fiumicino. Taste is thankfully more bitter than sweet. Pretty passable.

Pours golden thin lace top.  Aroma has pale malt and light hop berry.  Taste is medium sweet to bitter.  Palate is medium bodied average carbonation and a bitter finish.  Overall the mass lager of the Italian beach bar.

330ml bottle
Gold pour with decent head.
Grainy aroma.
Clean, crisp, sweetish.
OK lager.

Typisch meditteraans pilsje. Flauw dus. Wel kraakhelder, dat dan weer wel. Uit Italië.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33l can. Appearance amber colour, lovely head. Aroma corn, sweet malts. I cannot detect any bitterness maybe some very mild at the background. Palate medium bodied, average carbonation. Taste light malty, citrusy. Not a great pale lager of course but pretty drinkable. Summer beer obviously.

Bottled, Lago di Garda, IT, Malt,cereal,corn and light herbal aroma, Clear yellow, smaller head, Sweeter taste, light bitter finish, Weak body, average carbon, Not too bad and when chilled pretty easy going.
Hellgelb, kaum Krone. Etwas Getreide, etwas Stroh, leicht verwässert, eher dünnes Viel-trink-Bier.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.
Butelka 0,33l. Aromat kukurydzy i gotowanych warzyw. W smaku słodowe, wysoko nasycone.

A decent Italian beer, crisp and slightly sour. A good, if not excellent, accompaniment to a meal in Italy - Pisa in my case. But more of an acquired taste whist in the UK. The context is everything !

Light golden color with white head. Corn and malts on the aroma, with some bread and slightly grass. Taste follows the nose, grainy, bready and grassy, with sweet malts and a clean finish to it. Much better than Nastro Azzuro.

Für mich ein sehr gutes Bier... erstaunlicherweise besser als nastro azzuro... eine gute 5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I have no problem ordering this beer at an Italian restaurant. I think I even bought a six-pack of it once a while back. A borderline light lager, but not too skunky or swillish. Has a sweet slight malty taste, bits of corn....but smooth and crisp. Wouldn't be a bad lawnmower beer as well.
Considerably more aromatic then nastro azzuro. Grassy hops and gassy beer. On the malt side. Not good but far from awful.
Draft in Vaticano Restaurant in Zutphen. Nice golden yellow draft, taste is a bit sweet imo.
Bottle from supermarket in Italy. Golden color, white head. Pretty common lager, refreshing but not special
Poor aroma of malt and nothing more. Taste extremaly watery. One of the worst ever drunk

Et ganske godt øl, passer til det meste av mat. Også behagelig som tørstedrikk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Birra che sa di niente, ha dalla sua il basso costo che spesso l’accompagna nella grande distribuzione anche con molte offerte. Birra adatta a grigliate estive dove si prevale la quantità alla qualità

On tap as a special at a local sports bar. Hadn't a Peroni in many years. The appearance and head are good, nose of malt over hops. A smooth drinking pilsner. Nothing to do flips about, but still a nice European lager.
Una lager dorada brillante con espuma blanca mediana. El aroma y el sabor son maltas débiles, un poco herbales, casi sin amargura. Cerveza acuosa, solo para saciar la sed
Jasnozłocisty lager z średnią białą pianą. Aromat i smak słaby słodowy, trochę ziołowy, goryczka praktycznie żadna. Wodniste piwo, tylko do gaszenia pragnienia

12 oz bolle pours a clear pale golden color with small white head and minimal lacing. Aroma is a bit skunky, with grains and corn. Taste not much, but is slightly bitter at the finish. Body is light with a crisp mouthfeel.
B-. Pours a clear golden color with white head. Light on flavor, weird after taste
Ljus med obefintligt vitt skum. Doftar brödigt, lite sött. Smaken fyllig, lite maltig och söt. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång och lite söt.
Włoska klasyka. Barwa jasna, klarowna. Aromat nikły. W smaku bardzo wodniste.

330ml bottle from the shop, drunk at home. Pours clear with a short-lived frothy head, no lacing but some bead. Mid straw in colour. Aroma of hay, wet cereal and bread. Lively mouth feel driven by mid to high carbonation, releasing mild flavours of yeast, bread and cereal, quite bitter and no perception of sweetness. Overall, an uninspiring lager.
La classica birra da supermercato, si lascia bere specie se accompagnata da pizza o patatine. Ci sono affezionato.

330ml bottle in an Italian/Greek beach bar, Nidri, Lefkada, on 11th Oct 2017. Clear and clean golden body, white crown on top (but not for long). Sweet corn like aroma and taste, did not really enjoy it, even with the lovely view.
Clear golden colour with a small. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of hops, malt and bread.
On tap. Golden color with white head. Aroma is malty and floral. Taste is sweet malty with some bitterness. Overall it's nice and easy drinkable lager.

es la mas conocida larger italiana. en pocas palabras una autentica porquería. sabor burdo a malta y algo a lupulo. basicamente agua sucia. ligera, sin aroma. refrescante. una de las peores cervezas que he bebido. es increible como a los italianos les pueda gustar.
Koncerniak jeszcze bardziej ocierający się o smak wody niż polskie. Jedyna charakterystyczna i pozytywna rzecz to wyczuwalne nuty ziołowe, które ratują trochę całość.

Butelka. Piana średnioobfita, biała, drobnopęcherzykowa, opada do warstwy, koronkowanie słabe. Barwa jasnozłota, klarowne. Aromat średnio intensywny, słodowy, lekkie żelazo, czerwone jabłko. Goryczka niska. W smaku słodowe i lekka skarpeta od chmielu. Pełnia niska, nasycenie wysokie.
This beverage is exquisite. The taste lingers nicely on the taste buds that are on my tongue and in and around my mouth. As You Were BY x
Prefer this to Nastro Azzurro. Tastes far less sweet and less of ricey adjunctives. Refreshing and inoffensive, but little more.
The beer has got a clear golden colour with a small head and medium body. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of hops, malt, citrus fruits and bread. Mild finish.
Reasonable Lager, ok from the bottle, but nothing to get excited about. Drinkable.
Tap at Restaurant in Rome - pale yellow color, white head. taste is nearly nonexistent. pretty average lager. not really good.

Recently enjoyed several fresh pints of this on draft around Italy, and as far as European adjunct macro lagers go, its surprisingly tasty and refreshing. In most respects, just a generic sweet and grainy lager, notes of bread and some mild herbal hop flavor. Always looks fresh and appealing with a solid gold color and generous white foam and lacing. The thin palate betrays the corn adjunct but fortunately it doesn’t really come through in the flavor. Finishes thin and grainy, but is sufficiently crisp and refreshing on a hot day under the Umbrian sun. Although a decent thirst quencher, I would point Italian drinkers in the direction of Peroni’s all-malt Nastro Azzuro lager rendition, which otherwise essentially seems to be the same beer.
Bottle 33cl. Small white layer leaving. Quite flat. Clear pilsener color. Aroma is leaves, pear, grain, light malt. Taste is some sweet

Draft: Poured a clear golden color beer with a nice foamy head with OK retention and light lacing. Aroma of adjunct and residual sugar notes is OK. Taste is mostly dominated by adjunct and residual sugar notes. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. Not the best lager out there for sure.
Aroma: biscuity malt, grass notes. Taste: biscuity malt,bread,faint citric flavour. watery.
Refreshing with a slice of salty pepperoni pizza. Sad that an "Italian beer" is now owned be miller.

Pint, London. Pours a golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma: biscuity malt, mild citrus, grass notes. Taste: biscuity malt, very mild citric flavour. Thin body. Moderate carbonation. Moderate lingering bitterness. Not bad, but still not a good quality lager.

An Easy to drink, run of the mill lager. Peroni Red has little in the way of character. Lacking a strong aroma, there are notes of classic bitter hops and barley malt. A slight sweetness in both taste and aroma is likely a characteristic of the corn grits used in the mash. An attractive light straw hue, and light head of foam is classic lager. Smooth and slightly bitter, light copper flavour. This beer is fine with salted nuts in a quiet pub with game, simple, unfashionable and definitely one of the better mass produced lagers going around.

L’amaro è medio. L’intensità gustativa è leggera e la persistenza gustativa è corta. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è dissetante e semplice. Il retrogusto è leggero. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di pane, mais e fiori.

For some reason I ordered this at an Italian restaurant - should have just went with the wine...
Ljust gyllengul öl. Tänk er industrilager i doft och smak så har ni denna öl. Går inte att skilja från hundratals liknande.

cough drop, caramel, pale, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation,

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into wine glass (all I had).

Appearance: Clear, light yellow gold without much head and no lacing.

Aroma: Very light malts with hay, straw and barely perceptible apple.

Taste: Sweetish apple is a little more noticeable in the grainy malts, with a sharp hay-like taste. Spicy hops are minimal as it seems the hay taste is supposed to provide more of the counterbalance to the overly sweet taste.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation, light body, not at all dry.

Overall: An okay Euro Lager that really needs more dryness or crispness to compete against the better ones.

can in Rome.

golden hue, corny steely on the palate good length.. a very different beer to nastro the italians seem to prefer it

500ml can.  Pours pale yellow with a white head.  Aroma is slightly grassy, yeast, corn, sweet malt, faint pineapple, and glycerin.  VERY thin on taste.  Watery sweetness, light hops, bitter finish.  Really that’s it.  Boring defined.  If you’re thirsty this will do, but if you want taste, try something else.

Enjoyed to an Italian meal: Bottled. Pours clear yellow with a medium sized, white head. Nose of grain and fruity notes. Medium sweet flavour wiyh grass and hoppy notes. Light bodied, watery texture with average carbonation. OK served to a light meal.
Draft.  Pale, light head, clear. Mild skunky lager, not much that is special, taste is not great.   No reason to visit this again.
Bottle, in Italy. Not much to be said, it’s a standard mainstream lager. Drinks better cold.
Nicer than other beers for similer price Ok taste can’t complain about it not the best but not the worst
Mi garba la pubblicità della Peroni perchè invertono la o e la n e diventa per noi invece che peroni, appunto per voi, chi la beve se no...
Keg. Light straw yellow pour. Weak aroma and taste of grain, hay,  and mild hop and carbonation. Pretty weak beer.

Bottle. Light pale yellow color> head fades quickley. Smells of faint lemon grass, hops and hay. Tastes like a crisp macro pilsner but better then most of them out there. Not bad if theres nothing better to choose from among macros
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is light malty, corn and light hoppy. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry finish. Light bodied and watery. 120805
tap.   touch of grassy hops backed by cereal, dry bread malts and a touch of corn.  drinkable, though not particularly interesting or good for that matter.

Malziger, nicht viel aussagender Duft. Antrunk malzig herb, der Mittelteil fällt dem Wasser zu opfer, vielleicht ein wenig matellern. Der Nachgeschmack ist unangenehm herb und schäumt sehr im Mund, allgemein hat es zu viel Kohlensäure. Nene, so geht das nicht. 	 
Test vom 22.9.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 8,6,6,7,7,6 - 6,40
Clear yellow with a white head.  Herbal aroma.  Taste is light corn malt with a dry, spicy hop finish.  This is way, way better than I had expected and is more a pilsener than a pale lager.

16 ounce glass on tap.
I made a mistake at a restaurant  by ordering a "Peroni" Italian import beer that was nothing fancy at all, just a over carbonated American style lager.
( I could have had a Yuengling!)
A very pale straw color.
It seemed over carbonated, and definitely over rated.,

Bottle in Rome (la birra del rugby).
Light yellow with a white head. Aroma light to moderate malty (caramel). Flavor light to moderate sweet, light bitter, refreshing. light body.
Pint at Pizza de Marco.  Light Golden color. Malt and hops aroma.  Very light and crisp flavors.  Slight grassy malt flavor with hops finish.
Bottle.  Cold spring Sunday afternoon, Will’s front yard, go Rangers.  Beer is blech- light yellow fizz, sweet corn aroma, sweet taste,  One and done...
From a pint draft. Pale straw with minimal head. Minimal taste, but you can drink en masse. Italian Bud Light with more going for it.
A just alright beer. Great with pizza from Moon River. Nothing to write home about. Not enough going on to analyze it too much.

Had this several years ago and thought it was a little better than most other pale lagers.  It still has a relatively ’been there, drank that’ quality to it, but its a little better and fuller in body and flavor than most.

No visible beads , not when i poured it anyway although it didn’t taste flat. Just a really dull beer where if you want a heavy session you might start finding a crappy taste in your mouth after about 4 making you not want to continue. I would never buy again but i’m not too pissed off i got a case of 24 because i can mix them into various times etc... Really average if not slightly below. I got it cheap and theres a reason why it was. It’s not good. I have had worse however...

Bottle with a best before of 8/22/10 (!) - Pours clear straw yellow with a small foamy white head. The smell has turned sweet, with white grape, floral hops, honey and apple juice. Surprisingly pleasant. Surprisingly good taste, light and fizzy. Sweet without being overpowering--light malt, floral hops, and only a little bit skunked on the finish. Harsh, biting carbonation detracts, but couldn’t totally screw up the experience of this past-date pale lager. Crazy.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a slightly-darkened straw yellow color with plenty of visible carbonation and somewhat of a white head. Good lacing going down. The nose is actually slightly hoppy with a strong grain character. The taste is all grain although no corn, which is always a nice touch. Light feel with crisp carbonation. Not too bad, though not that good either.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-02-2010

Free bottle at some event at a clothing store. I don’t even care, this tastes like any other watered down lager, nothing, that is. Boring as hell, no taste, no aroma, like drinking carbonated water with a hint of beer. Don’t bother unless it is free.

0,33 l. bottle in an Italian take away, ordered with a pizza. Pours a light clear gold colour with a small white head. Nice carbonation. The aroma is that of a typical pale lager. Mild malts, corn, and citrus. Flavor is sort of refreshing. Crisp with light malts and corn. Nothing special, but the pizza was great!
a perfectly acceptable, middle of the road lager. basically an Italian Budweiser. nothing wrong with it, but not very exciting either.
No head pale yellow very mild carb and more or less tasteless.  I was expecting at least a little flavor.

on tap in Rome. Pours clear straw coloured with a big creamy white head. Aroma of sweet grain. Taste is sour thin malts, a bit of hay and grain, Sour thin mouthfeel with a short metallic end, not good at all.
Golden lager with minimal white head that is gone in an instant. Typical taste of grain, malt, and hops. Pretty under average brew.
bottle@Italian restaurant: very dry, cereal taste, bitter aftertaste, minor hops, drinkable and inoffensive, kind of very fizzy body actually not that bad for a macro lager
Bottle looks simple, beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild but not washy. A bit flat and metallically, modest hoppy-sourish background. Nothing special!

ate with some italian food.  i think i had this one a long time ago and it was way past it’s drink by date and badly skunked.  I checked this one.  it was fine.  The italian food was ok.  I have heartburn.  the peroni had a good bitter finish.  very refreshing and complimented the food.  I’d be excited to try this on tap.  You could drink a lot of this one.
12 oz. bottle, feels a little thin on the tongue, but headache-proof, even if you have a bottle too much.

12 oz. bottle. Pours light yellow with a thin head. The aroma is citrus and wheat. The flavor is sweet and tart with a bitter finish. The palate is light, acidic and very carbonated. Overall, a crisp and refreshing lager.

A little oxidised on the nose and not much else. It pours almost head-free. The taste is sharp but very neutral of flavour. The finish is not so harsh so didn’t actually grimace while drinking. Overall, I’ve tasted worse, but I would not take another.

Bottle.  Ghastly skunky aroma.  Light gold colour with thick fast dissipating head.  A tiny bit hop, more malt in the flavour with a ghastly metallic tang.  Interminable pencil finish.  This beer is an abomination.
66cl Bottle in Verona, Italy. Sweet hoppy aroma. Golden colour. Dry cereal flavour. Quite smooth for a lager. Dry aftertaste.
At D.O.C. Pizzeria Chicago. Golden colored. Clear. White medium sized head. Hay and sweetness in the aroma. Flavor of malt and metal. Is light sweet in the end. Not much power on aroma nor flavor.
330ml bottle sample had in an Italian restaurant in Edinburgh Scotland. Pours a straw colour with a very small ring of white head. Pretty basic brew, but all in all not bad.
23.01.2005. 0,33l Can. Pale yellow colour with white head. Weak malty aroma.
Wasn’t expecting much...and didn’t get it.  Bit on the skunky side of things...but then again I knew what I was getting into.

Peroni has a thick, white head and a very clear deep golden appearance, with lots of carbonation.  The aroma is slight, but some barley malt can be picked up with a strong sniff.  The taste is delicious, and it does have a good hop and barley malt balance, as per the description.  I enjoyed the full-bodied beer taste and mouth-feel and found it to be refreshing.  Also, it is not as dry as American lagers.  Overall, I really enjoyed it, and was glad the sample was not skunked (green bottle).  You should give it a try.

RJT
Fairly bland beer. Not bad for a hot day though if forced to drink lager. Bottle in restaurant, almost zero head. Refreshing is the best thing I can say.
Definitely a step up from bud, coors, etc. But nothing more than that in my opinion.
Very average lager.  Somewhat floral aroma with a light golden appearance. Moderately bitter with lively carbonation and an astringent finish.
What to say about Peroni? It’s a macro beer you usually see at Italian restaurants. The beer is good, it’s not going to blow you away. It’s a step up from Bud, Miller, etc - but only a step up.
Green bottle but no skunkyness to it.  Taste is between a Heineken and a Corona.
bottle. average italian beer. not bad if chilled but nothing special at all. light taste, golden color.
This beer is a bit like  a Heineken but with less flavor.  This is your standard middle of the road lager without anything special.
Nothing to write home about. Italy’s answer to cliche American lagers. Yet strangley better than the big beer companies. Clear yellow with little head leads to little flavor. Disapointed
Trošíčku nasládlý lehký pivko. Zpětně jsem byl překvapenej, že má až 4,7 procenta. Pito lohvové v Bukurešti v hotelu.
Yellow pour, fizzy white head.  Classic pale lager, grain, grass, and a touch of bread and biscuit.  Pretty good alternative to the classic macro lagers, but not much more taste.

Pours straw yellow with a loose white head.  This swiftly disappears and leaves no lacing.  The nose is of bread, anonymous sweetness and a light presence of lemon.  Then there’s a sweaty smell, familiar to cheap white wine.  The taste is of corn, bread, white sugar and that touch of lemon.  It has a thin, pissy body and a lively carbonation.  There is no finish whatsoever.  I suppose it’s better than some other lagers, but it’s still pretty rank.
Nem nagy durranás de nem is akar az lenni. Egy frissítő kis ital a forró nyári napokra. Ez kell az olaszoknak.
Golden yellow colour with frothy white foam. Malty and hopy aroma. Lightly sour, medium bitterness but very refreshing. Very light bitter after taste. Good lager.
Another beer that isn’t that bad, particularly when you are stuck at restaurant that only serves the domestic big guys.
Not much aroma at all. Tastes of corn but not overpowering.  A little bitterness which I like.  Finishes well.  A bit better than most generic beer.
Can. Slightly metallic taste, sweet, with low carbonation. I case you haven’t anything else, drink it.
Bottle at an amazing brick oven pizza joint in the village.  Pours a straw yellow with small white head.  tastes of corn, slight bitterness, maybe some lemon.
Pours a light golden color with a thin white head.  Has a sweet crisp taste with gentle bitters.  Clean refreshing finish.  A nice light lager.

Bottle at Cafe Mason, SF. Italian pale lagers are metal. I used to order this at the busted joints that didn’t card, thinking that if it was European it must be better than American piss. I know now that I erred in that judgment, but sometimes you still have to dive in and grab the monkey. It drank pretty good, didn’t it?

Clear light straw with a white head which fades quickly into a splotchy layer of lonely bubbles. Swirls with no lace, but I’m not really surprised. Her nose? Close thine eyes and you will be transported to fields of golden corn aplenty, blanched grains, and aisles upon aisles of equally bland boring homogonistic wonder bread. Waxy lemon skin and green grass for bitterness, and that be all she wrote. Now to taste the Peroni Lager… Light and grainy up front, her palate quickly descends into a dismal abyss of waxy citric skins and corn aplenty. Licking lips I find more unappealing wax, but wait, I’m not done yet. Delving once more into her palate, I find waxy lemon and corn kernels atop weeks old wonderbread and buoyed by a body of excessive carbonation. A couple more quaffs and it’s the same-old ‘meh’ as most macro lagers usually are.




Once more, macro lager mediocrity and bland sameness has passed these highly insulted lips, and once more I wonder at the sheer genius of marketability because really, that’s the only thing that differentiates one macro lager from the next. Peroni may have had her day back when I was a beer geek newbie, but not anymore. My tastebuds and my sensibilities know better.
Can - 500ml. Boring golden body with a thin white bubbly head. Aroma is almost non-existent. Taste carries bad metallic and CO2 notes. Finish is non-existent. Useless.
bottle. tastes like a pale lager. little to no aroma, not much different with the flavour
Pours golden with a light head. Aroma and flavor are just like every other lager you’ve ever tried. Meh.

Gold, white head that disappear quickly. Aroma is something like corn-flakes and cooked cereal, with a light impression of sweet malt. Hop doesn’t exist. Taste is simple, light sweet, with malt and corn. Horrible industrial beer.

Can 33cl. @ ChrisOs Pre-GBBF Shindig 2010.

[ Raise The Roof Tasting ]. Clear light to medium yellow color with a small, frothy, fair lacing, mostly to fully diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, corn, malt extract. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20100731]
A very average Euro pale lager. Well actually not that good.  But better than some of the other Peroni selections. Serving: Bottle
Pours clear yellow with a very thin head. Dull hop aroma. Nice mouth feel. Lots of saaz. Pretty standard Euro lager. Not much to say about this one.
Gold color with mild carbonation light breezy graininess and nearly imperceptible hopping. The flavor is of gentle malt grain. A slight, but decent flavor.
Peroni will from now on remind of one of the best nights I have ever had (previously), and one of the worst nights I have ever had (presently).
Very typical pale lager, little more crispness then the others.  Nothing special.
Bottle at Italian restaurant.  Pours light gold with small head.  Aroma of grain and malt.  Tastes a bit sweet with just a touch of hops.  Mainly skunky and metallic.
Not too bad for a pale lager, but nothing to get too excited about. Pretty much par for course for what it is.

Nothing special. To make matters worse, it didn’t pair well with the Italian food that I was eating. It was the only beer at the Italian restaurant however that I had not rated. Easy to drink, but not worth revisiting unless I’m dying of thirst.
On-tap in Cape Town, with the same friends during the World Cup. Beer just for fun... not for complex analysis... very light... bright yellow appearance. Easy and simple to drink.

Pours clear golden amber with rich white long lasting head. Sweet, hay/grass aroma. Nice malty, artificially sweet flavor. Not much on palate but finish is nice bitter hoppy. Typical mass produced lager but still a good beer for pizza.
on tap-pours a white head that laces with yellow color.  Aroma is grain/corn, slight hops.  Taste is grain/corn, some hops.bite.
Tap.  Pours a pale golden color.  Skunky, grainy aroma.  Taste is corn, grassy hops and some funk.  Not a big fan of this.

33cl Can on the flight to Rome. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of light sour grain, butter, light papery hoppy. Flavour is sour grain, butter, cardboard, light malty hoppy finish. Light bodied.

Pale watery golden, medium head.
Aroma is hoppy with some malt and skunk. Not bad.
Flavour is a light hop bitterness with some malty sweetness.
Not bad, just boring.
33 cl bottle. Definetely a bad bad beer. I didn’t like it, one of the worst pale lager
Clear pale golden color.  Aroma is of malts and skunk.  Flavor is also of malts, skunk, and corn.  Pretty watered down tasting.  Leaves a skunked finish.  Nothing impressive.  Similar to Heinekan.
Pale yellow lager. Nose and taste of nothing really. Slight malts. Mostly water. Rated 6/26/02
pours gold and yellow with a light fizzy head. Very malty and light. It does finish with some hop bitterness that other light lagers lack. It does have some skunky off character.
I had this as a draft at the Wrigleyville Rooftops during a cubs game.  Golden poor with a decent amount of head.  Smooth. Light.

Looked pretty much like a domestic light. Bubbly with a moderate white head that dissipates fairly quickly.  Smells kinda bread like. Nothing particularly noteworthy.  Tastes like nothing special. Light, grain/bread. Some hops.

Unremarkable beers can be pretty easy to drink...like water.  I have got to stop asking waitresses at moderate priced restaurants to pick the beer for my meal. That’s how I tried Kingfisher!

This is another one of those beers that I struggle to give any points. It was golden with a small head that fades away. The aroma was very skunky, which should be expected since its in a green bottle that is imported. The taste is also skunky with some corn in there. I do dream of a world were I can drink an imported pale lager that is not skunky. It also pains me to see people at the beer store asking for Peroni with all the great beer that is available.

Unremarkable, transparent yellow appearance. On the upside it has a little sparkle and a decent white head although it quickly vanishes. There are corn, grass and subtle citrus notes on the nose. The taste is decent for a pale lager. It is definitely watery, but thankfully not too sweet, and there is a very minimal amount of bitterness due to some minimal hop flavor. The finish, as is common with this particular style, is a little tough to swallow. Overall, pretty easy drinking, I can understand why it’s such a popular beer, but on the totem pole of beer, it is just an arms length above Bud.
This is a ptetty badic pale lager, almost pilsner. Easy drinkableband sessionable, but not very distinguishable.
Golden colour, medium head. Slight hoppy notes, little bitterness, rather ordinary. Nothing great, but still better than Nastro Azzurro.
On tap. Clear gold  fading  white head. Apple, corn, sweet aroma. Taste is watery and adjuncty.  Fizzy and dry.

330 ML bottle in Dubai, well what can you say about this beer. Its not terrible but not good either. Cardboard like character and litte taste. Head was white and stable. Aroma is very faint and useless. Nothing to write home about.
330ml bottle from the LCBO.  Pours a fizzy yellow with no head.  Smells like rotting veggies.  Taste is corn and skunk.  Ugh.  Not good.
Siamo nati e cresciuti con questa birra... più che altro con la biondona che faceva lo spot ;-) il 20 nell’overall è tutto per la mega gnoccolona!!!
Bottle. Clear golden with a small white head. The aroma is slightly metallic, light fruity and light hoppy. The flavour is the same. Highly carbonated. Dull.

I was pleasantly surprised by this one. I pale golden beer which pours smooth. Smells of subtle lime hints, and tastes a bit citrus-like too. Not a bad light beer. Great compliment to a pizza, that is how I have mine.
Swill.  no, wait let me correct myself.  European swill.  How this beer and Amstel are still on the market boggles my mind.

Best Before End: 04/13/10.

Appearance: Pours out a clear, lightly-hued yellow body with a wispy layering of white head.

Smell: Meager, insipid grainy malts with evident notes of skunk and gun metal.

Taste: Particularly light pale maltiness impaired with metallic, skunky, husky hints. Faint hop bitterness. Dry, fairly crisp finish. I couldn’t get to a glass of water fast enough.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: It’s faulty and unenjoyable, as so many of these lagers often are. More nasty than nastro.

330ml bottle (random shop, Rome)

Pale lager. A touch grainy aroma. Some dry oat biscuity taste. Finish a touch papery in places. Dull, not good.

Bottle. Pours a pale yellow color with a small longlasting white head. Has a fruity grainy malty aroma with some hoppy hints. Malty bitter and slightly hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy bitter finish.

Bottle. 12 oz. Pours simple blonde with a thin, fizzy white head. Arome of wheat, hops, and barley, and some sweet malts. Thin bodied with a very carbonated, slightly bitter mouthfeel. Not really much to this lager. Simple and relatively tastless.
Bottle. Mild hop aroma. Subdued hops, with some carbonation and an overall dull finish. Drinkable lager, but certainly nothing more than that.

Pours a very light clear straw-yellow with a huge pure white head and lots of effervesence. Aroma is hops and alcohol. Light bodied/ not very creamy on the plate. Taste is a little hoppy, a Pilsner type taste and dry, crisp and clear on the finish. Good beer for the style. Pairs well with lunch meats and snacks such as nuts, chips or cheese and crackers.

Despite this beer’s low rating I thought it was quite pleasant for a pale lager. Very crisp and refreshing. I think this beer would go really well with some wings or any other type of bar/grill food. Decent brew.
Pretty crappy pale lager.  Aroma is smelly socks.  Pours a pale straw yellow with minimal white head.  Taste is forgettable with wet newspapers and crap.  Pass.
Moist with sulphur. Not very complex or surprising, and personally I feel Moretti offers a bit more when having beer with Italian food.
Didnt find it all that good. Not very complex. Although it was easy to drink, I thought it was kind of bland. Needs a little more flavor.

On tap at Dallas Ginger Man. Clear as all day. Yellowish hue with a foamy white head. Smells of straight up grains and light hops. Quite the pale lager aroma. Taste has an immediate hint of skunk with overly sweet grain. Finish starts ugly but fades to nothing. Granted, it’s better than the Peroni Nasty Ass.
hoppy malt aaroma, golden, white, clear, medium bitter, medium body, average CO2, slušné europivo

Pours a light golden yellow with a small lingering with frothy head. Aroma grainy sweetness, some bread and a bit of a floral crisp hoppiness, skunky in the euro lager way. Flavor starts sweet and malty with a bit of honey. Quickly gets bitter and crisp with a cracker and grainy flavor and stays that way through the finish with a little grain sweetness. Medium light body and a sharper carbonation. Standard, better than some other pale lagers.
bottle, strange light yellow colour with unstable white head. Skunky smell: Taste: very industrial stuff with some alcohol and bitterness. I don’t like this one at all!
Bottle, 66 cl. Pipi yellow-golden colour, no bubbles, medium white head. Chemical, grainy and skunky smell. Chemical, watery, grainy taste.

64cL bottle Roma, Italia.
Don’t mind this one as staple "standard" Euro lager in Italy. Crisp, clean; malt flavour is nice and balanced quite well.

12oz bottle.  Pours a pale gold with a slight, quickly dissapating head. Very carbonated, spritzy mouthfeel. Taste had a touch of malt and a balancing bitterness.  Nothing that impressive.  The Bud of Italy.

A fairly standard and quite boring lager.  Take away the name and you could easily mistaken it for any of the BMC standard american lagers.  Don’t let the italian name and foreign exoticness  trick you into paying twice the amount for this below-average beer.  But you know as they say..."when it Rome.. . . .drink wine."
Bottled...Pours a lighter side of straw yellow with a fluffy white head..Flavor and aroma is sweet and bready... I’ve had worse.
0,3 l blik. Gekregen van Annelies en Berniek na hun reis naar Rome. Goede pilsener. maar niet bijzonder.

on tap: revisiting an old quaff I did decades ago at a favorite Italian eatery. I drank this often on tap. Now I review it after the SABMiller take over.

Pours a pale straw color with a quickly dissipating 1 finger cap.

Aroma is of boiled cereal and little elese

Some malt weak hop presence, watery and weak.

This is a sad shell of the beer it once was.
Pale yellow pour with a white head. A little skunky aroma along with grains. Taste is somewhat crisp, blah.
Typical boring lager .  Clean ,dry and lots of carboard malt . Why in God’s name would you drink this shit ?
Served in 400ml glass. Light yellow (as expected from a pale lager...). Slight bitterness. Other than that, not much to say...
Bottle - Pours pale yellow with a spritzy head which quickly disappears.  Aroma and flavoursmatch, light malt with a mild flowery hop.  Not as carbonated as the pour sugests nice mouthfeel.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in Plano, TX. Pours a light, clear straw yellow with small fizzy white head. Aroma of light floral hop and malt. Flavor has a nice light clean malt backbone with light hop flavor, light hop bitter. Mouth feel is light body, watery, high carbonation. Overall, a easy drinking, light tasty lager.

Familiar with the green bottle variety. 
Can’t make it through an Italian meal without a few. Any night that starts with Peroni & ends with Sambuca is a good one.
&#40bottle&#41. Clear gold color. Small white head. Light grainy aroma and flavor, with very light citrus. Avg duration. Smooth finish. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting! Really disgusting!

Bottle . A clear light straw color , with two fingers of fizzy white head , lively carbonation. Aroma of slightly skunked floral hops , and light grain . Flavor is malty up front with a floral hop finish and aftertaste . Thin mouthfeel , light body . Drinkable but not very good .
Golden pale body, with a short white head, minimal aroma at all, little flavor.  A poor lager choice
I’ve had this from the bottle and on tap.  Stay away from the green bottle - skunk, skunk, skunk.  Otherwise, it’s your average pale lager but with the perk of saying it’s Italian.

Pours a golden color with a nice white head.  Smooth taste, but not much depth there.  Really a one note beer that is high on the drinkablity.

12 oz. bottle
Can. Pale yellow with a white head. Grainy aroma, some hops, rather lively MF. Decent tasting but dull and watery.

Draft.  Pours clear gold with large fizzy white head.  Aroma of grain, malt, hops and more of the same in the wholly unspectacular flavor.  Too much carbonation, but refreshing in the right circumstances.  Nothing offensive about this one, but nothing to write home about.  No reason to really pick this one up stateside, as it’s going to be more expensive than domestic macros without offering much more.

33cl bottle from palladio, rhodes,greece.
clear yellow, thick white head.
sweet malty aroma, balanced by bitter hoppiness.
sweet smooth flavor, balanced by bitterhops, bitterness is faint, but complements the sweetness very well. i liked this a lot.

Always thought this was the same beer as Nastro, hence I’ve never rated it. Rucksack-cooked warm red tin in Boboli Gardins. Nose of grain, hay, sweetcorn, slight hop. Biscuity sweet and slightly lemony, some sprucey hop and cardboard rendered refreshing and clean by vacuous popcorn softness. Technically sound, clean and adjuncty, with no glaring off notes or any notes at all except popcorn. Top class Italian macro.

Just your average watery beer aroma here, some skunkiness and grains and not much else. Colour is very light and there’s no head to speak of. Taste isn’t too bad with some fruitiness to start and a bready aftertaste. Mouthfeel is refreshing anyways. This beer really can’t be recommended for any reason, but isn’t awful either.
Bottle. Weak malt aroma. Clear yellow colour with white head. Ordinary lager flavour.

Not much of a beer, but when you’re in Venice and it’s 90 degrees out... it’s not so bad.

Then again, in those circumstances, ANY beer would work.

Semi-skunky, pale and little or no head.

A standard Italian macro.
Not a whole lot going on. Not urine like the Beast but not good either....and whoa take a look at the price......hmm avoid...
Pours standard for a lager, aroma is musty and slightly gainy.  I’m not one to hate lagers, but this was pretty bad, skunky, bitter, metallic and some grain.  Nasty.

Canned in Italy.
The standard Italian macro beer, very pale, lively carbonation, no aroma, watery and thin. As boring as it gets.
Can on train between Sienna and Florence. Boring beer but refreshing in the heat.

Overall Impression: 
I’ve had this one a few times, and it’s pretty dull.  I would say Italy is not a beer country, you learn quickly to go for wine not beer when you visit, but it’s not like American Macros are better, so maybe they have good Micros? I’m doubting it, but I hate to judge a country’s beer by its macros, less the rest of the world judge us by Miller Lite!
330 ml bottle. Golden body with a white head. Weak malt/grain aroma. Flavor is like any other commercial lager, an uncomplicated thirst-quencher and nothing more. Quite boring actually.

I grabed a bottle of Peroni when i was in Rome last week and was not Too impressed. Its not the Worst beer i have ever drink, But not too great either. The Appearance was visualy Attractive, Was not much of an Aroma, The taste is nothing to brag about. Not something i would drink daily. But im more of a Brown ale, stout drinker, some people might really like Peroni.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with a sizeable foamy white head.  Nose has some grass, euro lager, slight vegetative note, and just a whiff of grain.  Medium carbonation with a light mouthfeel.  It has a light palate with a touch of grass, a little malt sweetness, kind of an adjunct taste, and some hop bitterness.  Medium short finish with a bit of lingering bitterness.  Not terrible, just not my kind of beer.
Straw with light, creamy white head / Dry, grain nose / Light body, very dry and hoppy, with fair finish / Grain flavor with an extremely dry and bitter finish / Unbalanced.

No strong taste, weak head and lace.

To me its watery and bitter.  Has a a definite skunk factor.

From a bottle this poured a light yellow with almost no head and no lacing. Nose is fermented corn. Fizzy mouthfeel.  Flavor is corn again with some grassy hops.   Slightly bitter finish. Best to drink this really cold to avoid the kind of skunky aromas and taste.

330ml bottle. Pale straw colour and very clear with a thin wispy head and mild carbonation. Grassy hop notes. Fairly indistinguishable from other mass produced beers. Flavour is okay with a mild level of bitterness. Better thanm some of the other Peroni beers.
Clean, wet, crisp. Clean balanced malt and hops. Quite refined for a light lager.

Pretty fizzy but pretty tasteless not quite sure how much I trust Peroni and given how expensive it can be I am going to have to rate it quite low. Sorry. 

Got to say this is simply a woeful chemical beer - I won’t be buying it again.

Standard pale lager.  The appearance is straw gold color, white head.  The aroma is malty, sweet, corn.  The flavor follows the aroma exactly, except maybe a grassy flavor lurking in the background.  The finish is bitter hops, like metal.  Not great, better than average for the style.

Bottle:  poured clear pale yellow with a little white head.  Smelled of corny malt Taste was clean and slightly sweet with a balnced bitterness, not complex.  Though not awesome by any stretch... it wasn’t all that bad.
i love italy and i love this beer i didnt think italians new any thing about beer i was wrong
Smells pungent, floral and sweet, yellow and clear, tastes fizzy and slightly savory- herbal. tastes like corn and has a stale, skunky tinge.

On tap at Via Tribunali.  Pours ultra clear yellow with a small white head and a few bubble trails.  You could watch a hockey game on TV through this stuff and follow the puck reasonably well.  Smells OK- corny malts and a hint of grassy hops.  Tastes similar, but with a strange finish of dried apricots/raisins.  Not as watery as I expected given the appearance.

Bottle. Pours with a very small, white head that soon vanishes. No lacing. Body is extremely clear and yellow. Immediately after opened, a very skunky aroma is present, which dissipates as the beer sits in the glass for a few minutes. Otherwise, the only aroma I get is fading skunkiness. Oddly enough, while it is light on the palate, its body is still slightly fuller than I would have expected from its appearance. Fizzy carbonation that continues while drinking. Tastes ok, not near as skunky as you would think from the odor, but the flavor is gone almost immediately. Lightly bitter, dry finish... and I do mean light. Great as a lawnmower beer, but if you want to really taste a beer I’d definitely recommend something else.

This Peroni example was in a green bottle.  Pours a clear yellow color, thin wispy white head and very low carbonation. Aroma is a light noble hops presence with the rest being a very corny grain presence.  Flavor has a light skunkyness to it, Saaz hops and pils flavors but both are very very light and finishes with a corn and skunk (again) ending.  Density is very low and the low carbonation doesn’t really help it out a lot.  Overall a PL that I probably won’t have unless it is the only thing offered.

2009 Bottle - Pours a lt yellow with a small white head, lots of bubbles...aroma is light grain and heavy lager skunk, but smells very refreshing...flavour is decently bitter and it lingers, but an odd bitterness at that, like too much hop extract without the hop flavour...still a nice departure from the other watery lagers...
Nothing special at all. Peroni has to be one of the most over rated and over expensive lagers around.
No flavor or body, but some good fizziness! I’m nice, so I gave it a 3 overall.  At Beerfest Miami 09 Like sparkling water.

On tap at Marie’s pizza.  Clear golden ith medium white head. Aroma is light lager with grain and subtle hops.  Clean flavor with grainy finish.  Thin with lively carbonation.  A standard import lager.

Bottle...  Poured a super pale golden with a thick white head that dissipated immediately.  Off, funky malts and floral earthy tones on the nose.  Overly carbonated and left a weird residue in my mouth.  Had an icky flavor profile that was unbalanced and tasted like pistachios.  This must be the Bud/Corona of Italy.

Draft - Pale golden in color, light hoppy aroma, and a crisp and clean flavor.  There isn’t much bad you can say about this beer, then again, there isn’t much good either.  There really isn’t anything remarkable about it.
Pours a clear gold with thick quickly disappearing head.  Aroma of grain apparent.  Taste is light, but very refreshing.  Not a bad beer, but nothing special.

Poured a bright golden color with a thin white head.  The aroma was is grainy, with citrus notes to it.  The taste was watered down, but refreshing.  It had plenty of carbonation, but not much flavor at all.  Great for cooling off on a really hot day, but not very enjoyable for a beer.
12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear gold color with a two finger white head.  The aroma was grainy.  The flavor was mainly a solid, malty base.  Not much of a bitter finish.
Bottle.  Nice golden color. Not a big aroma of anything special.  Higher carbonation, clean finish.  Nothing spectacular.
Rather unremarkable, nothing to write home about.  Certainly not a bad beer, but I found it somewhat lacking.

historic lager in italy.one of the best alternatives when you have not much money.i think i’ve drank 1000 litres of this.colour is pale,not sophisticated flavour with some barley malt taste.leaves a light bitter taste in your mouth

The original Italian lager. Peroni is the number one lager brand in Italy and has been for over one and a half centuries. This premium, clear, golden-yellow lager, with 4.7 ABV, is the result of the dedication to brewing of generations of the most qualified braumeisters.
On Tap. Mid-yellow clear color with quickly dissipating head. Aroma: Very faint hops and grass. Very light to weak palate and refreshing dry finish.
Golden pour with a one finger white head that is gone in seconds. Aroma is grains and corn. Flavor is sweet hops and skunky. Very light body smooth on the palate. Good beer.

A clear gold color with light lacing. MIld grain aroma, mild sweet flavor. Everything about this beer is mild-even has a mild soft palate. Not offensive but totally forgettable. Strictly a lawnmower beer-acceptable enough in a bucket of ice on a hot summer day. Never would have bought this except it came as a sampler of 3 six-packs(Pilsner Urquell, Tyskie and this) for $13 bucks so the price was too good to pass up. The Italians are great at food, wine and opera but apparently not beer.
Bottle. Multiple tastings. Had these primarily while traveling in Italy. Nothing exciting about this one. It is not that great but drinkable. Certainly better than a Bud or Miller.

2/18/2009:  I hadn’t had one of these for what seems like 8 years, so it seemed like something different to follow up the glass of Leinie’s 1888 Bock that I just had (which is deifnitely better on draught than from the bottle, by the way)...  Peroni has a clean and clear golden color toppbed by a white head and filled with a moderate to generous level of carbonation.  Its aroma and flavor are a refreshing blend of soft European malts and delicate floral and spicy hops.  It has a light body and the adjunct grains are somewhat evident, but it does a good job of quenching thirst and refreshing the palate.  All things considered, this is a decent Italian lager.



20 fl. oz. draught at the Old Bag of Nails Pub in Gahanna,Ohio.  Rating #626 for this beer.
Not sure why I never rated this.  Taste is similar to becks, not too bad.  Ill take it over heineken anyday.

But how could I forget!!! My lone rating from the Miller Tour!! Poured draft at the Miller Inn in Miller Valley (Milwaukee, WI). I had to work the bartender lady to let me try this bad boy, as this was not slated for our tasting, but was available on tap. Poured a yellowish clear pour, moderate white carbonated head that dissipates to practically non-existant. Aromas are grainy sweetness, corn and other grains, with light bitterness and a fairly smooth body. No harshness. Body is thin, watery, quenching. Light bitterness on the finish and some adjuncty aftertaste. Ok, better than some macro lagers, I guess. It gets harder to rate these and inevitably you just have to compare them by what you feel about them.
Very pale yellow, finger of soft white foam, aroma of light pale malts, some grassy hoppiness.  Taste is solid malt, with some hay, grassy hops, bittering finish

A nieghbor brought this one over you know man you gotta try this one. no words  I haven’t typed before what can i say boring,garbage,puke but I do know this they do make a fine wine and great food just not good beer oh by the way my wife and my kids are Itailian I think this was my first from Italy besides my wife doh

fizzy clear gold, medium white head, no lace.  nose of grain, undertone of corn.  flavor is mild corn, hint of other graininess.  medium bodied, dry finish.  this beer seeks to offend no one, and as such ends up being inoffensively boring.  i bought this bottle at the lobby bar in my st. louis hotel.
Golden with a small white head. Grainy aroma and is quite sour. The flavour is malt and hops. Sour and slightly bitter finish.

Bottle at The Headkeeper, Greensburg, PA. Pours a clear golden yellow, small white head. Aroma is malt and corn. Flavor is malt, corn and a touch of hops. Thin and light, just a tad bitter, a non-offending beer.

Bottle. Pours a clear light yellow with a small white head that quickly fades. Lots of carbonation. Aromas of cereal grain, corn, grass. Taste is watery with some grassy hops in the background. Mouthfeel is almost creamy compared to other pale lagers. Finish is a little bitter and lingering from the grassy hops approaching cardboard. Another pale lager....
italian beer sucks... sorry if i offended anyone, but really, it’s just a really light lager and doesn’t look like a beer at all, if i can see through it that easy, it’s too light for me
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow body with a white rocky head.  Light grassy hop bitterness, grainy, lightly floral body with a metallic lingering.

Completely clear light yellow pour with a decent sized white head and lots of carbonation streamers.  Standard lager/pils aroma, this one seems fresh.  Grainy flavor up front with slight toast/bisquit.  Spicy hop flavor, probably saaz or another noble hop.  Crisp finish.  This is a good lager, underrated on this site I think.

660ml italian bottle, bright golden color, with an off-white head, wet grainy malt nose with a faint honeyed pale malt accent, and a hint of hay in thearoma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp honeyed pale malt character, with a hint of vanilla, light flowery hop note, leading towards a malty, lingering hop bitterness finish.
LIGHT GOLD COLOR WITH A MEDIUM FOAM HEAD. NICE MILD TASTE.THIS BEER IS JUST AN AVERAGE BEER.
Bottle, pours light gold with a very thin head.  Aroma is light hay.  Taste is boring, heavy carbonation, light bitterness, next to no malt flavor.  Boring.
Pours yellow with a thin white head. Faint aroma a some malt a touch of metallic hops. Flavors of smooth malt but no bitterness to back. Light body and very clean to mildly bitter finish.
chiara schiuima media non molto persistente note leggermente maltate un po di cerele lieve erbaceo in bocca piatta cerelai luppolo boh

Bottle bought @ Mitra Hengelo. Pale blonde. Apple and cream in the aroma. malty, chalky flavor with apple and some old flowery hops. Not exactly bland, but with some offsetting vegetable notes and cardboard.

At an mitra in purmerend, golden, smal lasting head, like pale lager but with some pilsener grainy and hop hinds,
Some skunky at opening the bottle,  very nice pale-pilsener.
Canned, Golden blond coloured beer with some light carbonation and a small white head. Hoppy grainy and light sweet aroma. Medium palate. Finish is light bitter hoppy touched. Medium pale lager.
gold blond coloured body with a little white head a sweet spicy hoppy aroma a spicy hoppy bitter taste with a bitter finish
Clear golden blond coloured beer with few carbonation and no head. Sweet aroma a little herby. Full sprankling palate. Finish is herby and sour.
33cl bottle, clear yellow color, malt and corn aroma, metallic sweet flavor, medium body, finish with hops notes, boring
Pale yellow with a nice foamy white head. An aroma of dust, hay, weak malt. A thin flavor with notes of sweet malt and hops. Pretty boring lager.
Bottle. Pours clear and light golden, with faint hops and yeast on the nose; similar on the  palate, with a sharpish taste. Heavily carbonated, with decent and durable head.

On tap.
Pours a clear bubbly straw color with a bubbly white head that showed very good retention and lacing.  Smell is very nondescript with hints of pale malts and mild hops.  The taste has a slightly hoppier kick to it with a little bitterness in the finish.  The pale grains are present in the background throughout.  The mouthfeel is very crisp and dry with lots of carbonation.  This is actually a decent lager on a sunny summer afternoon.
Peroni is a light looking and tasting lager.  It reminds me a lot of Harp with its light taste and limited palate.

Light golden color witha thin whitehead and plenty of bubbles.  Skunky scent underneath a slightly floral aroma.  Flavor is about the same with a bland watery somewhat citrus flavor.  Has a slight skunky finish that hangs in the back of the throat.

0.33 l bottle bought in a shop in Durres, Albania. It poured pale yellow body with medium sized head. Quite faint lemony hoppy and some dusty and strange malty aroma. Flavor is not so watery as you get used for the style, but without any character, just plain and so boring. OK, there is some sweet flowery/honey malts with notes of corn, quite different in one way, but still it doesn’t help. Shorter, mostly tasteless finish. Lower average pale lager, drinkable, but nothing more.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with heavy who found it in Albania (thanks!)
 Poured a yellow body with a small but thick white head that went away fast. Hoppy nose, somewhat dusty and sulphury. The taste is weak, bread, sulphur... mostly water. Not much hop, just some bitterness. Corn detectable. Special version for the Albanian market? Doubt it. Just a below average industrial pale lager.
Pale yellow lager. Smells skunky. Tastes of foliage from start to finish. Thin and outrageously overpriced. Avoid.

A rather boring beer.  Not much for aroma, mainly weak malts.  Appearance is a pale yellow with a white head.  Flavor is mostly water with a weak malt background.  Palate is metallic like.  Its not terrible but I’ll never drink it again.

Bottle from the Utah State Store. Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head that goes down to nothing quickly. The aroma is sweet malts and corn. The taste is similar; lots of smooth and sweet malt and corn, a ton of metallic flavors too. Way too much. I really think this would be much different fresh in Italy. At least I hope so. Not horrible, but not too good.
Bottle--Poured a pale yellow color with a medium head.  Soft, skunky smell with the typical pilsner/bud taste.  Nothing special at all.

(Drank on 2/22/04)
its light and crisp with some flavors of low malts of hay and corn like. very light on the palate.

It’s like the ghost made of corn and water flew up my nose. A bit skunky, watery, and bland. Anyone who tries to pair this with a nice Italian dinner is fooling themselves (besides, what are you drinking beer at a nice Italian dinner for anyway? You should be drinking wine). Not the worst but you’re not missing anything.
Pours piss yellow into a shaker.  Bright white micro head with medium retention recedes leaving no lacing. Adjuncts and off-skunk aromas. Crisp upfront but sweet and cloying in the sour finish.

What other good option is there at the Olive Garden???  Poured clear yellow in color with a white head that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of light grassy hops, pilsner malts. Tastes of earthy mild hops, pilsner malts, grainy and pretty bland. Watery and thin mouth feel.

Fairly typically served in Italian restaurants across England. Can be charged very high prices for this. It is hard to see why it should be highly priced when the actual flavour is pretty dull really, somewhat sparkling but disappointing and unsatisfying. Poor.

On tap in Manhattan Kansas Gold with a white head and spotty lacing. Lively carbonation. From 3 feet away, I can smell the skunk of the lightstricken pilsner malts. Other than that there is some light hops. The flavor isn’t half bad. Some musky pils malts and a touch of sweetness. Slightly bitter hops. Palate is sharp, slightly acidic, the body is light and it finishes of with a bitter bite at the end

I had this in the bottle at my local Olive Garden resturaunt. It poured a Budweiser-straw yellow with a decent head. Now, dispite it’s watery mouth-feel, I really didn’t think this beer was that bad. It actually had a great finish, which went down smooth and almost reminded me of a Hefeweizen. The price was right, and if I were to choose a European macro, it would definitly be this.

On tap. Water, corn, rice, boring.  Oh wait, it’s like Italy has their very own miller light.  If you can hold up the glass of beer between you and the menu, and still read the menu, it’s a pretty shitty beer.  Clear as hell, with no head.  No Aroma.  Tastes of sweet corn with a fizzy body.
draft at campisi’s.  Not much too this beer. Reminds me of bud with slightly more kick.  Watery.

Date: 08/03/2008

Mode: Draft

Source: Summits - Woodstock



Appearance: clear yellow, wispy white head, 

Aroma: light sweet cereal aroma, 

Flavor: sweet cereal malt flavor, light balancing floral hops, light bitter finish, 



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 5/20

Rating: 1.8/5.0
Drinkability: 6/10

Score: */4

12oz bottle. Pours a light clear yellow with little head. No lacing on glass. Aroma is faint with some spice and grass but little else. Flavor is typical for a lager: light grain, some hay, slight floral presence with a hoppy and slight bitter finish. Light, watery body overall.

While I was in Italy, it was refreshing on a 95 degree day. Still, its a crappy pale lager, but better than a Budweiser or MGD. Has a little more spice to it than American pale lagers in my opinion. Maybe some day Italians will take pride in their beer...eh, doubt it.
On tap. Slightly darker than BMC. Not much aroma or taste. but some grain. Weak head.

On-tap at Paris Las Vegas. Pours clear, straw yellow with a thin, fizzy white head, some lace. Smells light and grainy, somewhat rotten corn, sourish. Tastes light and grainy bitter and then sweet. There is a faint light hop flavor. Thin, dry body with vibrant carbonation.

330 mL bottle.  Very pale gold with no head.  Aroma of corn and wet hay.  Weak malty/corny flavour.  A tiny bit of hops at the end, but the bitterness fades quickly.  Quite highly carbonated.  Harmless, but not one I’ll go back to.

Golden with an OK head. The aroma is mild with notes of malt and light hops. The flavour has a light sweetness, notes of malt, light citrus and caramel. It’s light all over, but it’s quenching and easy to drink in hot weather.

I had a couple of these to wash down down my meal at Angelo’s in Little Italy NYC......really just your typical golden lager....thin white head......easy drinking.....it worked well to revitalize my soul during a tough day of trudging around NYC in 90 degree heat.....a nice easy drinker, but nothing special.
bottle.  fully dissapating small white fizzy head into a golden body.  aromas of skunky kick, sweet corn, and some hay. not bad for a mass produced brew.
Bottle Pours out a yellow topped with a white head. Aroma of malt and grass. Tast more of the malt. Not much else goig on.

While I was in Italy, it was refreshing on a 95 degree day. Still, its a crappy pale lager, but better than a Budweiser or MGD. Has a little more spice to it than American pale lagers in my opinion. Maybe some day Italians will take pride in their beer...eh, doubt it.
Can. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt. Flavour is fruit, malt, hint of hop. Thin and boring beer.

Tap. Have had this both in Italy and in the States. Equally sad. What it lacks in aroma and color, it equally lacks in taste. The ONLY reason to buy it is if you REALLY want a beer that’s Italian. And that’s not a good reason. Save some money and get a cheap American beer if that’s your thing.
Yellow color.  Smelled skunky.  It is a shame Italy is linked to this beer.
Pale yellow with a very weak head. Flavor was also kind of weak. The only good thing about this beer was that it was only .25 cents at the Italian festival!

Poured a pale straw yellow-golden bosy with a medium to small white head.  Spicy, nutty, grassy nose.  Much like a Heinekin in every regard.  Sweet, spicy, boring graininess.  Not terrible, but more for getting fucked up than quaffing for craftsmanship.
...bottle.  I don’t know why anyone likes this overpriced italian trash.  Tastes like water, with the cheapest hops, but way more expensive.  Don’t bother.

On tap at Bank. Very clear pale golden body with a small white head. Sweet grass and honey aroma. More sweet honey, light grain and a grassy floral finish. Medium light body and moderately high carbonation.
I was in an Italian restaurant, the food was great but the beer was toss. Weak, very weak tasting. Not impressed.

pours a sparkling golden color with white head.  Flowery hop aroma and subtle hints of sweet malt.  Light bodied with good effervesence.  Taste is slightly sweet grains at first, then mildy bitter hop finish which is short, but appetizing.  Good accompiament to seafood scampi or or shrimp alfredo.
Bottle: Clear yellow colour, no head. Aroma of malts and some dry hopy ending. Flavor is almost the same, thin watery mouth feeling, a typical international lager. Borring.
pours a very clear golden color. aroma is a bit fruity but has an incredibly weak taste. goes down very easy

Can. It pours an unsurprising clear, quite pale golden body, with only a thin lid of white bubbles on top. It’s fruity on the nose, but weak, and there’s also a little grainyness. The same problem goes for the flavor, it’s weak, grainy and fruity, lacking a lot on bitterness, but it feels fresh, it’s refreshing and quenching, and easy to drink. Not much carbonation, but a lot of water. Boring and uninteresting, but drinkable. (080521)
Another brew I consumed quite a bit of while in Italy. Pours a straw yellow colour with little to no head. very grainy, plenty of corn noticeably strong malt character.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass.  Very pale yellow like a natty light with avid, big-bubbled carbonation and nothing of a head.  Smells like a simple, cheap, Macro lager: corn, malt, water.
