Pale fizzy yellow.  Light floral scent.  Some hoppiness, a faint promise of malt.  Guzzlin' pizza beer.

Was not impressed. Bad after taste. No good head. Color was so so.
For the price, terrible.
Pretty standard stuff. Better than the BMC crap over here, but this beer is still just euro swill. I could stand to drink it though.
Yellow in color with a small frothy white head. Aroma is light malt with some floral hops. Flavor is bland. Finish is thin and weak.
Heavy hop aroma, golden straw colour, big head disapates quickly, sweet tasting with soft bitter aftertaste.

Imported Bottle. So what makes it an Italian beer? This and Moretti suggest a bit more hop bitterness in a light lager. I had this cold (that is, I was cold) at an outdoor mini-Italian fest in Chicago in October. Nice golden color under a thin but persistent head. I can taste the malt, balanced by an agreeable hop bitterness and yeast bite. Noticeably more body to it than you'd expect, and finishes well. Matches well with a hot Buona Beef sammich.
Golden color with a moderate head and fair lacing. Malty aroma with a spicy hoppiness. Light to medium body, with a malty and slightly tangy flavor and a mild hoppy background. Dryish finish. Decent.

Light watery color, aroma was lighlty hoppy and floral, far beter than i was expecting. Taste was lightly bitter, with some citrusy, slighltly spicy hints. Finish was watery and lightly bitter. Beter than I was expecting, but I was expecing it to be terrible.
Except for some mild grain flavors and some citric fruitiness, this is a pretty plain and watery lager. Has a decent crispness and is easy to drink. Has the standard green bottle skunk, too.
A drinkable yellow lager. Nothing special, but there are no major faults either. Could use a little more flavor, though.
Pours a yellow golden color with a fizzy white head. A light aroma with malt and hops. Somewhat dry but a very smooth taste. Not a bad beer.

Pours with a pale golden body topped by a medium thick white with good lace.  Slightly sweet malty aroma with a good hoppy balance.  A slight skunky aroma underlies the prominent aromas.  Slightly sweet flavor with a good balance, leaning towards malty.  Light bodied and smooth yet slighlty dry.

Drinkable? Yes. Exceptional? Not really.  I had a few of these at lunch today and wasn't blown away.  A very light and dry style that reminded me of a typical European light lager.  When I think of Italy, beer never comes to mind but, not a bad effort from our friends in Italy.
(Bottle and draught). Very light golden colour, moderate head. "Neutral" pilsener flavour (yes, another one!) Drinkable, but Nastro Azzurro is better.
Very blond beer with a small quickly disappearing head. Hop aroma. Light bitter hoppy taste. Nothing special. Ordinary cheap lager.
The most popular beer in Italy?  Well obviously the Italian masses like swill too.  The rating will read like Bud, Miller, etc.  Yellow, fizzy, puny aroma, bland flavor.  To be avoided.

Pale golden yellow color with a medium sized white head. The aroma is a little skunky with some faint hints of malts and hops. It has a light body with high carbonation. The flavor is nasty cardboard malts with stale hops. The finish is thankfully short with some hop bitterness. It tastes like cardboard and hay, which is not a good combination.
This is just Italian Budweiser.  Minimal palate, very bitter 'Anheiser-Busch' taste.  No body whatsoever. It made me a sad panda.

Not much to distinguish this beer from so many other "premium" lagers. Hint of maltiness in aroma and flavor and some actual hops are recognizable as well but not enough to really tantalize the taste buds. Reminds of Heineken with less funkiness.
Pretty good beer. Great with Italian food.  Rich full-bodied taste.  Would definitely recommend to everyone

Had this one at an Italian restaurant - should have gone with the Chianti, but I wanted another rating...  Pours, smells and tastes rather like so many other dark yellow, fizzy lagers.  Worked to wash down the (delicious!) gnocchi, but that's about it.

Color is a clear medium yellow with a fluffy white head that was about a finger high, has some divets and left small clingy lacing. Smell is faint of sweet malt and grain and a bit of floral hop. Taste is clean and lightly sweet of malt with a bit of drying crisp hop thats very subtle. Nice over all light and sweet body with a easy smoothness thats pretty drinkable with a slightly crispy dryness in the finish which can help settle any garlicy pizza.
Tastes just like Birra Moretti. Not much here to taste. Carbonated, fermented yellow water.

Light golden color with a fizzy white head. Floury biscuits and light dried floral hops aroma. Yes this a "bad" lager night. Visiting the Parents with the kids and thought I would grab a sixer of imports I have not had in a while.  I remember why I haven't had them in a while now. At least this one has a touch of body. Grassy malt flavors with a finish that is right up there with chewng on the lawn.
Gee, it tastes exactly like heineken.  Is that some sort of coincidence?  Blah Blah Blah.
A fairly standard lager.  No real distinguishing qualities.  An average beer.

Tastes like corona, just slightly better.  Had this as my girlfriend drank a corona, and they were EXACTLY the same color.  The flavor was also nearly identical, with a bit more maltiness.  Thin, watery, and lacking.
not bad, but id did remind me of canadain beer.  It had that skunky smell and a skunky taste too it.  It was a kittle dark then a canadainbeer and finished with a slighty hoppy bite.
Carbonated water. If you've already had a few beers, this one won't taste like anything but carbonation.

I'm starting to worry whenever I read "premium" on the label. This is just another mass produced, watery excuse for a lager. Italy- please stick with the chianti. If this is a full body, the body must be Ally McBeal.
Very weak. almost no flavor at all. highly carbonated. kind of like seltzer wtare really.
I was told by my cousin in Italy that there were 2 Italian beers and they both suck.  I wonder what the other one is called.
I was very unimpressed with this lager.  It was very watery and the taste was not very enjoyable.  It has nothing special about it.
Pale golden yellow with zero head. Smells skunky but doesn't really taste that skunky. Slight nutty hops and malt. Very carbonated.

I try this crap to punish myself or maybe to make the good beers I drink taste that much better. I don't really know why some companies even bother making this so-called beer. It was slightly skunky with a little citrus and hops. Lots of carbonation and a very light palate.

Yellow. White head dissipates quickly. Fizzy otherwise. Completely overwhelmed by Italian food; I don't know why they bother. There's nothing specifically offensive about this; just another interchangeable lager.

I don't know if the description of "full-bodied" is entirely accurate.  Although it is very easy to go down.  I think that is in part because it really is fairly characterless as far as flavorless.  As Voivod said, "not terrible"
I think the title "#1 selling beer in Italy" is a little skewed.  This was one of the skunkiest beers I have ever had.  Only the Kingfisher was worse.
Golden colour, good head, typical lager appereance. Almost no aroma, just a little bit malty. Sweet, watery flavour, with very few hops in the finish. Not terrible, but even flavourless.

The aroma is very skunky, with light floral and hop hints.  The appearance is a clear gold, with a thin head that leaves an oily film rather than lace.  The flavor is kinda tangy, a bit of a hop bite, and even taste a bit skunky.  The beer is smooth and crisp.  Overall ok, but nothing special.
An ok beer for its style, but nothing special.  It's pretty bland with a little hoppy bitterness.  I like Moretti better.
Fizzy, yellow, watery, blah blah blah.  Just like every other bland macro pils.  Just because it is from italy doesn't mean it is cool.  Move along.

An average at best look to this one, though not SUCH a light gold color as to be completely unattractive.  Aroma is fair, though a little skunky, in my opinion.  Flavor is actually not what I expected at all.  This one is lightly bitter and surprisingly smooth.  Not bad, but I'm still waiting for an Italian beer to really impress me (though I've only had two).
A remarkably tasteless beer. Bland in every respect. Yellow. No head. No aroma. Slightly sweet. Barely detectable hint of hops.
decent lager a little pale in color, but nice head.  Taste is unremarkable with strange aftertaste; worth drinking though just to read krisbierjaeger's rating.

Just another lager.  I have had worse, but then I was not expecting much after a few other Italian beers, so I was not as disappointed as some of the other reviewers may have been.  Flat taste and a really off finish.  Rerated 7 April.  No taste.  No malt, no bitterness, just the faintest hint of floral hops, and still with a slightly off finish.
Upon first glance it doesn't look like too much, yet it is a good tasting beer.  It lacks flavor, but is a well balanced lager.
Compared with stablemate Nastro Azzuro, this is crisper, slightly hoppier, but loses refinement (mostly in the form of grassiness. in the process.
Well, there's not much good I can say about this beer, except for maybe the 2/3 liter bottles but it ends there.  Flavorless, putrid aroma and generally bland.
Smooth and light, this is a good beer. While a little bland it is of high quality. It is not full bodied enough but that is my only real gripe.
Yuck. Very thin and watery. Very pale and light. Little on the skunky side. Not very good. Italians should stick to making wine and vermouth.
Well all I can say is.... I had Peroni.  This was like the Ultra-light of beers as far as flavor, depth, color head and taste is concerned.  It was just to weak in all areas for me.

not a great deal to report here.  a basic mockery-of-munich style lager: post-it note wan yellow, visibly brisk carbonation, light grassy grains and a clean but not profound aroma, brisk with a watery and dry lightness that lends itself to large, throat bathing and quenching swallows.  i didn't feel that note taking was necessary to give a plausible account of the product --if it had subtle notes of tuscan roses or lombardy lilac in vernal bloom, i must have missed it.  i did enjoy this italian beer with italian food, peroni being the most interesting offering at an "olive garden" restaurant.  but i didn't percieve any palpable "oneness" or special connection that the beer had to the food, as people so often report of say: a taco and a tecate while in tijuana.  it's true that at one point the ravoli seemed to wink at the beer, but that was possibly just my fanciful imagination, and though i brought it to the attention of the wait staff and patrons of adjoining tables, i wasn't able to bring anyone else up to my level of enthusiasm because the phenomena wouldn't repeat itself; on the contrary i was asked to simmer down or i'd have to leave the establishment, which diminished the supposed "when you're here, you're family" aura of total acceptance in all my famial flaws.  i complained about the frosted glass, and though the waiter called me "buddy", i think there was something dead in my vegetarian ravioli.  some type of mammal, i'm sure.  being "family", i did offer to help clear off the dishes, but again was rebuffed. all things considered, the beer was a bright spot.

(23Jan2003--12oz.bottle)
Hmmm, not terribly flawed, but neither is this outstanding.  Pretty average.
Thin head, strangely lumpy and nonuniform.  Non-lacing, mostly receding, extremely coarse bubbles at first; finer later.
Dominantly fruity aroma, lightly yeasty.
Tangy hop flavor, but sweet.  Bitter enough.  A bit skunky.
Pale yellow gold with a light body and mild bitterness. Floral hop notes with a clean finish. Lots of carbonation. Italy should stick to making wine instead of beer.

Another frikkin green bottle, you would think I would learn to say away from these in every day life.  But no....  The only reason I can even see wanting to drink this, is if you are at an authentic Italian restaurant.  Then it goes well with the food, but other than that you have no reason to drink this beer.
Very well suited for Italian food. It was a little skunky smelling and tasting. Light in the mouth. Decent but not great.
Middle of the road simple lager.  A little skunkiness kinda like a lot of Euro lagers.  Worth trying but wouldn't buy again.
This reminded me a lot of budmillercoors. Poor head retention, very high carbonation, watery taste. Not much here
Not much flavor for a lager, and not worth a higher import price in a bar...

An above average, though non-spectacular lager. Went very well with a heavy white cream, sun dried tomato chicken pasta dish. Nondescript aroma, small, mostly diminishing head. Nice flavor and finish for a mass produced lager, though wont be buying it again.

In the interest of full disclosure, I drank this mainly to add a new country to my list (Italy! WooHoo!). Anyway, completely nondescript. No flavor to speak of, nothing unique. Dosen''t particularly compliment Italian food, but doesn''t hurt it. Get wine instead.
really pronounced hop flavor.  tasted like a skunky European Pilsner........
I get this every time I get Italian.  It has a unique flavor, with a hint of sweetness.  A little different
Bottled(660ml). -golden lager but not so good, hoppy and refreshing.........

skunky nose on multiple tries followed by a typical lager with maybe a bit more body than most. Can''t get past that aroma. finishes fairly clean. Ponies are good since you get to say "pony peroni" while drinking less of the beer.
I would have never tried this beer unless a friend had ordered it first.   No aroma, no hop taste, golden color, diminishing head, and thin body.

Big white head, clear straw body, sweet malt-accented nose with a hint of typical Europils skunk. This stuff tastes bad - overly sweet with nasty off-flavors, probably from adjuncts. No hops to speak of.
Very average, but maybe alittle better than Michelob... Not a bad aftertaste, and smooth.
Appealing golden flax color with nice amount of activity.  Pleasant malty aroma.  Surprisingly smooth and well balanced malt flavor with hint of sweetness.  Surprisingly a decent beer.
not many in my circle of friends like this beer..but i found it to be a decent brew. nothing to bad..nothing to good..just a decent beer to drink on a sunday afternoon.
A nice brew from a country more known for there wine.It had a very light hoppy aroma some maltyness in the flavor but not much ,clean smooth finish.All around not bad for an italian brew
I end up drinking this beer too often. This is just as bad as most of the american macrobrews. Waste of time and money.

Not good, fizzy head that lasted all of about two seconds & then nothing for the rest of the glass, urine colored, very light bodied, a faint hop presense in the flavors, a little bite of hops in the finish as well, but just not a great beer at all
Pretty decent for my lack of liking lagers. Swayed by a great Italian meal and gorgeous women in the restaurant. That always makes things taste better.
I''m not much of lager person, but this would has to be the best one I''ve had. It''s very smooth and goes great with light meals.

Not bad for a lager from a country not known for its beer.  No real discernible aroma (i.e. not skunky), slight, quickly dissipating head.  Very smooth, slightly malty flavor.  Stays strong throughout - strong, smooth finish.  Good choice for an Italian dinner.
Slightly sour with a leathery taste. Has the funk of the skunk. I''ll not try this again unless it''s over Bud.
Pale yellow, with small head.  Mild aroma and flavor.  Drinkable, i.e., better than most generic lagers, but that''s about all it has going for it.
Very nice flavor, different than most pale beers............................
Well, it''s drinkable, but not very enjoyable...............................
pale yellow.  Grassy, grainy, slightly skunky, thin and watery.  The one thing it had going for it was a mild hoppiness.
Had this one 5 years ago. Not very good from what i can remember............

Exemplifies the hideous International Lager style.  Heineken-like skunk and hop nose wafting up from effervescent pale gold body.  The head is destroyed practically upon contact with the glass.  Heineken-like malt and hops.  Totally uninteresting.
Clean golden color with a decent white head. Unfortunately, not much taste. Not a terrible beer, just not a lot happening on the tastebuds.
The best Italian beer.  Nice balance to it..................................
Average skunky european lager.  Malt flavor honeyed and not horrible, but not a beer to search for (understatement of the week)
Light small Head frothy, white, fully diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Medium body with light hoppy aroma and flavor.  Not much in the way of malt.  Have had worse.
Not as good as Moretti, but I still like it with pizza.  Some pizza joints do Moretti, others do Peroni.
Terribly nasty skunked fizzy light weak foul almost clear light yellow crap get out of my mouth!

No outstanding specific flavors...  Tastes a lot like Tsingtao and a lot of the other big brewery import lagers, but a little lighter.  I'd drink it again althought I won't go out of my way to find it.

Not horrible.  Crisp and clean.  I found this lager to be much better than some others out there.  While low on any distinguishing characteristics, it's an easy to drink brew, with slight aroma and taste of hops, moderate carbination, and no bitter aftertaste.

Not overly impressed with this beer.  Complexity is minimal. A good aroma quickly fades on the first sips.  Slightly hoppy flavor with a quickly fading aftertaste. Try only when very cold.  Good with shrimp scampi over fresh pasta.
I drank this beer straight of the shelf in Venice once, when it was 42 Degrees Celsius, smelt and tasted like shite.
Maybe I had a bad bottle of this. The aroma and flavor was that of cigarette ashes! The taste was so strong and distinctive that I just couldn't drink the whole bottle. I'll try this again someday.
not worth the hype, bitter as shit, gets better after a few, wierd aroma and sits very heavy

Clear gold. Thin white head. Steady carbonation. Buttery aroma, kind of crisp. Light and smooth with a hint of Spalt hops and buttery flavors. Not much malt depth. Not very palatable with food as well. Overall just bland.
not full bodied at all.  i have had worse and better........................
Not very enjoyable.  No real outstanding characteristics.  Water was most prevalent, but everything was mixed together without any balance or, well, flavor really.
Not a whole lot of flavor.  Drinkable, but expensive. Went well with some veal parmigiana, if I remember correctly ...
Light body, golden yellow color, a little skunked...........................
sweet, fizzy, yellow, crap. i didn't even finish this stuff, cause it sucked so hard.

Hoppy and sweet - smelled more like a Bohemian pils than a lager. Very small white head atop a gold-yellow dull beer. Medium carb and light, watery body. Tasted salty, a bit sour. Some hops/malt and mild bitter. Weak flavor and no after. Not a really good beer.

It's a lot like regular Peroni with reddish coloring in it - this came out at the time of the Red Dog craze (if there ever was one).  A passable "red" lager.
Earlier Rating: 5/28/2002 Total Score: 2
Mine was a bit skunky, frankly, probably because of the green bottle.  It's probably a smidge maltier than a Bud (maybe).  Corn?  Rice?  I'm trying to identify all those not-so-flavorful adjuncts.

Not bad!  I am partial to green bottle beers.  A bit of a skunky taste, but not too much.  Easy drinking.  Just wish it wasn't so expensive.  If it was the same price as cheap domestics, I'd choose it.  Otherwise, no way.
Not memorable, but that means it isn't terrible, either.....................
Something about it just wasn't right. It wasn't bad but is wasn't good......

yellow colour with a thin foamy head.
standard lager taste  but with more body than most factory beers.
bitter hop finish.

Light amber with medium white head. Not hoppy, somewhat sour and grassy.  Aroma is lightly yeasty and somewhat 'powdery' somehow.  If you're stuck in an Italian restaurant, order the red wine or the Moretti La Rossa.

Re-Rate 05/15/02: Clear gold in color, minimal white head and some lace. Nose is malt, front malt, top light, finish is acidic, dry, moderate carbonation, but in truth a quite forgetable beer all around.

Mid-yellow clear colour with quickly dissipating head. Very faint hops and carbonic acid mineral water  aromas. Very light to weak palate and refreshing dry finish. Not bad for an Italian macrobrew.
(Rated 5/5/02: Chawton UK)
i liked this beer, it's a decent lager brew. tried it only once while out on a sail boat with a good crowd, no wind of course, no gas of course, we just drifted in after a couple hours
The Italians need to stick to wine and pasta................................

Light amber color, very clear, thin head that dies immediately.  Aroma on mine pretty skunky and unpleasant.  Flavor also rather unpleasant; I'd best drink this fast for a buzz and just put the taste behind me.  Uggh.  If there are any good Italian beers besides Moretti LaRossa someone please tell me!
Nice crisp, dry refreshing hoppy pilsner but nothing too exciting. Lightly metallic aroma. Decent but I think Moretti is better.
Not a bad beer, but nothing there to set it apart from a number of others. This is a very easy drinking lager but you can get something that tastes this good for much less.
Swill. Overpriced swill. It was my first attempt at and Italian brew and I must say that this must honestly be Italy's version of our Natural Light. Dear god, its swill.
An above average light beer with a good helping of hops. Very refreshing but nothing special.

I'm with psychprof on this as my first impression was that this reminded me of a thinner Pilsner Urquell. A decent amber color minimal hop bitterness, a malty/ricey flavor and low carbonation. Still a rather refreshing beer.

Seems to be going for bohemian pilsener; malty, slippery, very little hop bite. Some good aroma had me for a moment and then...nah. Not the real thing. But then again, I was eating at the Olive Garden (also not the real thing) with my wife and the three monkeys I occasionally call my children (definitely the real thing).
Reasonable lager commonly found with Italian food. It has few standout characteristics but is clean and easy-drinking enough.
Italian Becks.  Sometimes the only beer that you can get at a pizza place...
Re-tried this stuff recently. Boy my tastes have changed. Which pretty much means this stuff sucks.
I have the sinking suspicion that any "#1 in it's country" beer is awful. Coincidentally this tastes as bad as the #1 beer in the USA. As such, I doubt I will ever bother with it again.
Fairly clean lager with not a lot going on in flavor country. Typical bland lager that was way overpriced.
A nice clean lager, with little aroma or head.  It is a malty lager which reminded me of Bud, but has an odd flavor in the finish.
The first thing I noticed about this beer was its sweetness. It's really unusual to find a lager that was that sweet, but it wasn't sweet to the point of making it difficult to drink.

A nice, unassuming beer that doesn't try to clobber you with any "can you top this?" aspects.
At the end, a tasty, enjoyable, moderately memorable brew
that doesn't terribly impress, but doesn't disappoint, either.
Not a favorite, but not likely to offend anyone. About what you would expect from a lager.
My 2nd import ever. Had it with pizza at Double Dave's. Went well with it.

re-rate: Light gold with no head, but decent lacing.  Aroma is mild if non-existent.  Flavor is quite bland: virtually no malt.  Lingering bitterness is from hops but there's a strange off-taste to it that makes me think of adjuncts.

Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), lightly hoppy (flowers), with a hint of soap. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, husky. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.
This beer has a skunky smell but the taste is better than the aroma. Fairly good beer by flavor.
This beer has a skunky aroma but the taste makes up for it.  Good lager import.
Wow!  Had one of these at the cozy little Italian place the other night.  Sometimes it's good to try new things.  My introduction to Italian beer, and a positive one at that.
It's not the best beer technically in the world, but damn do I enjoy drinking it.
Pale yellow. Light bodied & soft. not much flavour, but not as as unpleasantly thin as many beers in the same style.
"Italian Budweiser"? I understand the moniker. This was ricey,skunky, and pretty watery. Thought it was decent with pizza, but then I drank it by itself. Truly vile.
What do Italians know from beer? It's called Moretti! Drink this ti fnish your list at a local bar, and be done with it. Too many hops, not good at all.
Thin and then thin, it is just another international lager with nothing to recomend it.
Smells skunky, tastes bitter, but it's clean and refreshing. I like to have it w/ calamari fra diavlo.

Smells skunky, tastes bitter, clean and refreshing. I wouldn't drink more than one or two of them, but I like the bottle and it's the only Italian beer I know. I like to have one while eating zupa di pesch at Amici's.
much like heineken with that tart aftertaste................................
THIS ITALIAN BEER ISNT BAD. NICE DARK YELLOW COLOR, WITH A DECENT TASTE. DOES LEAVE A SOUR TASTE IN YOUR MOUTH AFTER SWALLOWING. NOT BAD WITH PIZZA, BUT I WOULDNT WANT TO DRINK ALOT OF THEM

Very heineken like. Leaves no displeasing aftertaste and is very light and refreshing. Quite refreshing with any italian meal. The color is a tad like city water with a gold tint, but nobody's perfect. Very decent. Good food beer
Italy is the land of wine, not the land of beer, if you drink Peroni premium lager you know why! Rubbish!!! Igneousboy is right!
tastes like fosters, corona, heineken..only somewhat better.................

i agree with volgon, this beer was a difficult pint to finish. maybe if you mouth is full of herb's and spices, this beer might be ok, but as a stand alone brew, it's a rough ride. at least its not a boring ride like most A-B products
It is a challenge to taste this beer........................................
would just as soon drink a cheaper beer with pizza..........................
What I drink when I go to the pizza/pasta place.   An above average pilsner that is crisp and clean.   Nothing good or bad stands out.

Just average as far as lagers go.  Indeed, italians should stick to wine.  Me and some friends went to this girl's folks house in Seattle over the Summer and her pops had this in the fridge.  That was probably the first and last time I had this beer.
Great beer.  Has a light taste and the feel of a carbonated drink.  It was a nice change.
I thought that it went really well with what I ate (chicken marsala), however I think in the futrue I'm going to stick to the Italian's wine instead of our beer.
Chianti is my drink of choice with Italian fare. This beer is a good example of the reasons why.
In my limited experience of imported brew from Italy, Moretti is good stuff, this isn't.
Nice head and color. I wouldn't call it full bodided though. Reminds me of Beck Beer. Smooth and a nice balance. Good Italian Beer!
Another quality beer you can order with food without worry..................
I thought it woul better. I really didn't enjoy this........................
A summery brew.  Seems like it would be a good drink on a warm day.  .......

Standard import lager style. This one's fairly light, but shows some dry crispness with some moderate malt. A mild hop appearance shows in the finish. Has some German lager characteristics. OK overall, but not worth a top shelf price.
